thread.title: Trump, Carson demand that next debate be limited to 2 hours
thread.title_full: Trump, Carson demand that next debate be limited to 2 hours

title: Trump, Carson demand that next debate be limited to 2 hours
text:
Updated: 5:14 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 | Posted: 5:13 p.m. Thursday, Oct. 15, 2015 Trump, Carson demand that next debate be limited to 2 hours Related Republican presidential hopeful Donald Trump gestures as he speaks during a rally in Richmond, Va., Wednesday, Oct. 14, 2015. (AP Photo/Steve Helber) Sponsored Links The Associated Press WASHINGTON â€” 
Republican presidential candidates Donald Trump and Ben Carson are threatening to boycott the next GOP debate over its proposed format. 
The two political outsiders wrote in a joint letter to CNBC on Thursday that they will not appear at the Oct. 28 debate unless its length is capped at two hours, including commercials. 
They also insist that the debate include opening and closing statements from all the candidates. 
The last GOP debate, aired on CNN, stretched on for a marathon three hours, earning complaints. 
CNBC says in a statement that it's aiming to host "the most substantive debate possible" and will be taking the candidates' views into account. 
Trump and Carson have developed a unique rapport, with little fighting between the two. Copyright The Associated Press Sign up for our WHIO-TV Daily Headlines Newsletter Sign Up
